course.title: Contemporary Criticism: Graduate Seminar
course.description: An introduction to current critical debates, and a survey of the major scholarly genres. Together, we'll read the most important theoretical texts of the past decade, which have tended to focus on questions of method: what counts as evidence? what constitutes context? how should we read? We'll also read journal articles and scholarly monographs with an eye to their generic conventions. Independently, students will immerse themselves in debates specific to their own fields, and they will draft and revise a conference abstract, a review essay or position paper, and an article.
